And your bird is green
This song is about person who thinks he has everything in the world. But he can’t get the Beatles. Green bird = money
You say you’ve seen seven wonders

Lists of “Wonders of the World” are typically seven long, after the traditions Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. The only one of those wonders to survive is the Great Pyramid of Giza.



This could also be a reference to a meeting between Bob Dylan and the Beatles in 1964. Paul McCartney, high on pot, proclaimed that he had learned the secret of life and that “there are seven levels”.
You tell me that you’ve heard every sound there is
Some people didn’t think the Beatles were doing anything new. More pity them.

You may be awoken
 I’ll be ’round, I’ll be ’round
The music of the Beatles will continue to bring people joy long after “your bird” has stopped.

When your bird is broken
 Will it bring you down?

Lennon is here dismissive of the singing bird, which can be understood as a metaphor for whatever makes this person happy. One day, it will “break” – they’ll lose their position, and the bird will stop singing.

But you don’t get me
 You don’t get me

Like Rain, And Your Bird Can Sing hinted at knowledge unbeknown to all but the enlightened, showing the influence of LSD. It is also likely that the oblique lyrics were an attempt at writing something akin to the wordplay of Bob Dylan, whose songs Lennon greatly admired.



The song could also be a reference to a press release about a Frank Sinatra TV show for people who were “tired of kid singers wearing mops of hair thick enough to hide a crate of melons.” The Beatles were known for their mop tops. Anyone who dismissed them in this way couldn’t appreciate the great music that The Beatles were making.



Lennon was later dismissive of And Your Bird Can Sing, describing it as “a horror” and “throwaway”. Paul McCartney claims to have helped Lennon write the song.

And Your Bird Can Sing was John’s song. I suspect that I helped with the verses because the songs were nearly always written without second and third verses. I seem to remember working on that middle eight with him but it’s John’s song, 80-20 to John.
-Paul McCartney

When your prized possessions
 Start to weigh you down
 Look in my direction
 I’ll be ’round, I’ll be ’round
When stuff you think would make you happy becomes the opposite, That person will still be there for you.
You tell me that you’ve got everything you want
Seems like a shot at people who think they have access to anything. This is invalidated by the upcoming lyrics in this verse.
And your bird can swing
Marian Faithfull was reportedly bisexual– Jagger’s bird was a swinger.

But you can’t see me
 You can’t see me
Though the Stones and the Beatles were friends, there was a constant rivalry between then and Lennon often felt that the Beatles were always creatively ahead of the Stones.
